snippet: In several large cities, protests were organized by activists who wanted to use the day to denounce injustice and to point out social inequality.
abstract: Nation's holiday observance of Dr Martin Luther King's birthday is accentuated by activists' protests; demonstrators in several cities including New York, angered by deaths of several unarmed African-Americans in police confrontations, denounce racial injustice and inequality.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood from Boston; Alan Blinder from Athens, Ala.; Richard Fausset from Atlanta; Jon Hurdle from Philadelphia; Colin Moynihan from New York; Jada Smith from Washington; Mitch Smith from Chicago; and Eli Yokley from St. Louis.

lead_paragraph: In several large cities, protests were organized by activists who wanted to use the day to denounce injustice and to point out social inequality.

headline.main: Martin Luther King’s Birthday Marked by Protests Over Deaths of Black Men
headline.print_headline: King Events Punctuated by Protests Over Deaths of Black Men
